strings.Value: "An odd name for an elf."
"What are you doing here?"
"Who are you?"
"Concerning your request..."
"What sort of help do you need?"
"I can't agree to anything before I know what exactly you need..."
"And what do I get if I help you?"
"So be it. I will help you."
"Is this the flower you were looking for?"
"I have no time for this."
"You still haven't told me what you want from me..."
[Say nothing]
"I've already agreed to help you..."
"Very well."
"No way. You're on your own."
"All right then. I have to go."
"If you agree to work for me, I'll build you a workshop here."
"I have no idea."
"Can you pay for it?"
"You wanted to know if there was a place you could settle in around here..."
{n}Before you is a tall, pale elf, the soft features of his face sharply contrasting his angular figure. But his woeful gaze is fixed on the ground.{/n}
{n}He finally notices you and, startled, blinks at you absent-mindedly. He talks slowly, slightly elongating his words as he speaks.{/n} "Good day!"
{n}The elf shrugs.{/n} "My parents named me Kimiel. But my friends decided this name didn't suit me so well…"
{n}The elf blushes ever so slightly and lowers his gaze.{/n} "I… I can't tell you. It's a secret!"
"Although... if you promise..." {n}The elf looks at you with hope in his eyes.{/n} "If you promise to help me, then I will tell you!"
"Kimo. Kimo Tavon." {n} With a wide smile, the elf slowly nods at you.{/n}
"That... that is a secret!" {n}After some hesitation, the elf decides to add,{/n} "But it's not hard. Not at all! You have my word."
{n}The elf wrinkles his forehead in concentration.{/n} "Well... if you insist..."
"Hmmm... In that case I... I will give you my spear! I can make a lot of handy things out of wood. You could call me a woodworker in your tongue." {n}The elf gives you a disarming smile.{/n}
{n}The elf is shining.{/n} "Wonderful!"
"I see..." {n}The elf sighs.{/n}
"So? Will you help me?"
{n}The elf just keeps smiling at you.{/n}
"Oh, right."
"Perfect! Come back as soon as you can!"
"Yes?" {n}The elf looks straight at you, his eyes wide.{/n}
"It... it is beautiful." {n}The elf reverently accepts the flower from your hands.{/n}
"Bye!"
"I thank you. You have helped me so much! Here, take my spear. My skill is nothing compared to the beauty of nature... But who knows — perhaps, you will find it useful."
"Tell me, friend... is there a place here where I could settle in? I do not wish to leave this place."
"Well, if only with my work... I work with wood. I make spears, bows, and shields."
"You... you would really do that for me?" {n}The elf's mouth opens in amazement.{/n}
"Yes?"
"I see..."
{n}The elf gives you a pensive look.{/n} "Good day!"
"Well, if you're offering this to me… than I gladly accept! It's a deal."
